site.title: Stop Crypto Validation
site.description: Timeline and repercussions of Hungarian cryptocurrency "validation" laws

home.title: Crypto Validation: Demand Change | Stop Kriptovalidáció Hungary
home.description: Hungary's crypto validation law is forcing service providers out. Crypto validator requirements remain undefined. Learn the facts and contact your representative.

about.title: About | Stop Kriptovalidáció - Crypto Validation Hungary
about.description: Citizen-led initiative documenting Hungary's crypto validation law. Learn about crypto validator regulations and contact your representative.

mp_detail.description: {{name}} MP details and vote on Hungary's crypto validation bill (T/11922). Hungarian crypto validator regulation voting records.

crypto_validation.title: What is Crypto Validation? | Crypto Validator Hungary
crypto_validation.description: The law does not define what crypto validation means. Learn about crypto validator requirements and regulatory consequences.

hero.title: Hungarian crypto owners are at risk
hero.description: Users are losing access to crypto services because the crypto validation law is forcing service providers out of Hungary.

overview.title: What's Happening?
overview.law_summary: As of July 2025, Hungary has unique <kriptovalidalasLink>crypto validation</kriptovalidalasLink> requirements in effect, impacting approximately 500,000 Hungarian crypto owners.
overview.uncertainty: The law does not define what validation means. This creates legal uncertainty: neither individuals nor businesses can follow the rules, service providers are leaving the country, and violations may result in criminal liability.
overview.compliant_explanation: On this website, only service providers that have publicly announced compliance, or have been confirmed compliant by SZTFH or Caduceus, are marked as "Compliant."

crypto_validation.title: What is crypto validation?
crypto_validation.intro: Act LXVII of 2025 introduced the concept of "crypto-asset exchange validation service." The law mandates validation requirements but does not define what validation actually means.
crypto_validation.unique_text: The concept of crypto validation exists only in Hungary. No other country has introduced similar requirements. The European Union's MiCA regulation does not include this type of validation obligation.
crypto_validation.criminal_text: Crypto-asset exchange without validation constitutes a criminal offense in Hungary. The regulation prescribes criminal liability rather than administrative sanctions – this is unprecedented in international comparison.
crypto_validation.what_we_know_text: Crypto-asset service providers can only perform crypto-asset exchanges if validated by a validation service provider.
crypto_validation.what_we_dont_know_text: The law does not specify what validation means exactly, what processes it involves, or what criteria make a transaction considered validated.
crypto_validation.validator_intro: A crypto validator (officially "crypto-asset exchange validation service provider") is an SZTFH-licensed company that validates crypto-asset exchange transactions according to the law.
crypto_validation.validator_requirements_text: Validator service providers must have an SZTFH license. Currently, only one licensed validator operates in Hungary: Caduceus Zrt.
crypto_validation.validator_problem_text: The exact content of validation is not defined in the legislation. Some service providers choose to leave Hungary rather than attempt to comply with unclear requirements.
crypto_validation.sources_text: Read more about the regulation in these sources:
crypto_validation.cta_text: If you would like to express your opinion about this law, write to your district representative.

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.description: Stop Crypto Validation is a citizen-led initiative created to raise awareness about Hungary's crypto validation law. Our mission is to inform Hungarian citizens about this legislation, which threatens financial freedom and digital security by mandating globally unique validation requirements on cryptocurrency transactions.
mission.privacy: We believe that financial freedom is a fundamental right, and that maintaining free competition among crypto service providers is essential for protecting the interests of Hungarian crypto owners. The crypto validation law undermines these protections, exposing citizens to new risks and forcing service providers to leave the country.
mission.platform: Our platform provides easy-to-understand information about the crypto validation law, tracks service provider status, and helps citizens contact their representatives to express their concerns.
mission.inspiration: This website was inspired by the <fightChatPolicyLink>Fight Chat Control</fightChatPolicyLink> project, which fights against the EU Chat Control regulation. We encourage everyone to participate in that initiative as well.
mission.disclaimer: We are not affiliated with any political party.

contact.title: Contact
contact.description: If you have any questions, corrections, clarifications, update requests, or feedback, please reach out at <emailLink>info@stopkriptovalidacio.hu</emailLink>.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.analytics: We use privacy-preserving analytics through Plausible, which does not use cookies and does not collect personal data. For more information, see <plausibleLink>Plausible's privacy policy</plausibleLink>.
privacy.email: When you use our contact tool to email representatives, all processing happens locally in your browser. We do not store or transmit the content of your messages.
privacy.cloudflare: We use Cloudflare as a caching service to improve website performance and reliability. Cloudflare may temporarily process IP addresses and basic request information as part of its service, but this data is not used by us for analytics purposes. For more information, see <cloudflareLink>Cloudflare's privacy policy</cloudflareLink>.
privacy.changes: If we make any changes to this privacy policy, we will update this page.

contributions.title: Contribute
contributions.description: This project is open source and we welcome contributions. If you would like to suggest bug fixes, new features, or content updates, visit our <githubLink>GitHub repository</githubLink>.
contributions.howto: Open an issue with your suggestion, or submit a pull request with your changes.

timeline.telegram_cta: Join our Telegram channel for updates:

impact.title: You Are Impacted
impact.description: This regulation affects not just service providers, but every Hungarian crypto owner directly.

zero_compliant.title: Zero Compliant
zero_compliant.description: No exchange can achieve compliance because the requirements are unclear. Despite government claims, service providers continue to leave.

stricter_than_mica.title: Stricter Than MiCA
stricter_than_mica.description: The EU's MiCA regulation does not require this type of validation. There is no explanation for why Hungary needs stricter rules.

criminal.title: Criminal Liability
criminal.description: Violating the regulation can result in criminal prosecution, not just administrative sanctions.

unique_validator.title: Unique Requirement
unique_validator.description: The 'validator' concept does not exist anywhere else in the world. Hungary alone introduced this burden.

private_monopoly.title: Private Monopoly
private_monopoly.description: Validation is handled by a single privately owned company, Caduceus. An allegedly 'important' public interest task is now a private monopoly.

individual_punishment.title: Individual Punishment
individual_punishment.description: The law does not just regulate service providers—it punishes individual crypto owners too.

exchanges.title: Service Providers
exchanges.description: Status of crypto service providers in Hungary.

moonpay.summary: Hungary is listed as an unsupported country.

action.title: Take Action!
action.intro: The crypto validation law is putting Hungarian users' access to crypto services at risk. Service providers are leaving Hungary one by one. Select your district representative and send them a message.
action.email_warning: You selected many recipients ({{count}} emails). Some email clients may not handle this many recipients. Use the copy buttons as a workaround if needed.
action.copy_manual_hint: You can also copy the message and email addresses to send manually.
action.list_selection_hint: After selecting your representative, you can also add national and minority lists to the recipients.
action.list_warning: Your email client may not handle this many ({{count}}) recipients. You may need to manually divide them into batches if you want to send them all.
